definition: Aleksandr Kolchak (1874-1920), Russian naval commander, head of anti-Bolshevik White forces
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: Kolchak's fleet was successful at sinking Turkish colliers.
sentences.chinese: 高尔察克的舰队很成功的击沉了土耳其矿船。

definition: Petrograd, variant spelling of 彼得堡[Bi3 de2 bao3], Saint Petersburg
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Benito Mussolini (1883-1945), Italian fascist dictator, "Il Duce", president 1922-1943
Cheka, a Soviet secret police agency, forerunner of the KGB
White Guard or White Movement, anti-communist troops fighting against the Bolsheviks during the Russian Civil War (1917-1922)
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
Borodin (name)/Alexander Porfirevich Borodin (1833-1887), Russian chemist and composer
